Copy Project/Select Configuration File and Access Control Database Dialog

Use the Select Configuration File and Access Control Database dialog box of the Copy Project wizard (Edit | Copy) to select a configuration file and access control database for the new project.

Field Descriptions

Configuration File Use existing Configuration Files: References the original configuration files in their original location, thereby sharing the existing configuration files with the item you are copying.

For 5.3/6.0 projects and project roots, the existing configuration files are shared between the old 5.3/6.0 project or project root and the new, copied project or project database. We do not recommend that you use existing configuration files if the project, project root, or any of the projects in the project root use an access control database.

When you choose this option, the Access Control Database options are grayed.

Copy existing Configuration Files: Copies existing configuration files and place them in the new project or project database's structure.

Create a new Configuration File: Creates a new default configuration file for the project. The default settings of your configuration file are controlled by your Administrator.
Access Control Database Use existing Access Control Database: Copies the project to a new location but continues referencing the existing access control database. This option is not available if you select the Use existing Configuration Files option above.

Copy Access Control Database to new location: Select to copy the access control database to the new project location and place it at the root of the project database directory. This option is not available if you select the Use existing Configuration Files option above.

Create a new Access Control Database: Select to create a new access control database for the project. This option is not available if you select the Use existing Configuration Files option above.
